intro: Cryptantha capituliflora var. compacta, commonly known as the compact blue flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small flowers make it an ornamental plant in native gardens. The species is also valued for its role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
